com.github.katjahahn

Class IOUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.katjahahn.IOUtil

  • public class IOUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for file IO needed to read maps and arrays from the text files in the data subdirectory of PortEx.

    The specification text files are CSV, where the values are separated by semicolon and a new entry begins on a new line.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String NL
      System independend newline.

    • Method Detail

      • readMap

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> readMap(java.lang.String filename)
                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the specified file into a map. The first value is used as key. The rest is put into a list and used as map value. Each entry is one line of the file.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the specification file (not the path to it)
        Returns:
        a map with the first column as keys and the other columns as values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the specification file

      • readArray

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public static java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> readArray(java.lang.String filename)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the specified file from the specification directory into a list of arrays. Each array is the entry of one line in the file.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the specification file (not the path to it)
        Returns:
        a list of arrays, each array representing a line in the spec
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the specification file

      • readArrayFrom

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public static java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> readArrayFrom(java.io.File file)
                                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the specified file into a list of arrays. Each array is the entry of one line in the file.

        This method allows to read from files outside of the packaged jar.

        Parameters:
        file - the file to read from
        Returns:
        a list of arrays, each array representing a line in the spec
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file

      • getCharacteristicsDescriptions

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCharacteristicsDescriptions(long value,
                                                                      java.lang.String filename)
        Returns a list of the descriptions of all characteristics that are set by the value flag.

        This is intented to be used for string output of characteristics.

        Parameters:
        value - the value of the characteristics field
        filename - the name of the specification file (not the path to it)
        Returns:
        description list, each element is one characteristic flag that was set

      • getCharacteristicKeys

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCharacteristicKeys(long value,
                                                             java.lang.String filename)
        Returns a list of all characteristic keys that have been set by the value.
        Parameters:
        value - the value of the characteristics field
        filename - the name of the specification file (not the path to it)
        Returns:
        list of the characteristic's keys that are set

      • getCharacteristics

        @Ensures(value={"result != null","result.trim().length() > 0"})
public static java.lang.String getCharacteristics(long value,
                                          java.lang.String filename)
        Returns a description of all characteristics that are set by the value flag.

        This is intented to be used for string output of characteristics.

        Parameters:
        value - the value of the characteristics field
        filename - the name of the specification file (not the path to it)
        Returns:
        formatted description for all characteristic flags that have been set
